key_points: The docuseries 'Man in the Arena: Tom Brady' debuts on ESPN+ on November 16.
Directed by Gotham Chopra of Religion of Sports, the series recounts Tom Brady's Super Bowl appearances and career milestones.
The series delves into the emotional and psychological aspects of Brady's career.
New episodes will be released weekly on Tuesdays, with a special presentation at 9 p.m. ET followed by a post-show called 'Inside the Arena'.
Tom Brady describes the series as an inside look into his 22-year journey in the NFL.
Each episode focuses on a different Super Bowl appearance, beginning with Super Bowl XXXVI.
The series is co-produced by ESPN, Religion of Sports, 199 Productions, and NFL Films.
Brian Lockhart, SVP at ESPN+, talks about the series highlighting Tom Brady's epic journey in sports and his complex character.
The series will feature exclusive interviews with key figures from Brady's life and career.
Companion programming includes the 'Inside the Arena' post-show, 'After the Arena', and the 'Man in the Arena' podcast series.
spokespersons: Brian Lockhart (Senior Vice President, ESPN+ Original Content and ESPN Films)
